forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 44. North northwest wind 2 to 10 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. East wind around 5 mph.

weather_report:
As evening settles over Downtown San Francisco, the sky reveals a mostly clear expanse, poised comfortably around the balmy low of 44 degrees. The delicate hush of a gentle north-northwest breeze offers a soothing whisper, as the city begins to unwind from the day’s bustle. While the night may bring the chill of winter, tonight’s clarity presents an inviting canvas, free from the persistent fog that often embraces the bay.

As you consider the day ahead, Saturday greets you with a partly sunny disposition, promising a high near 56 degrees that may slip gradually to around 54 in the afternoon. With the eastern wind softly teasing your collar, it is wise to dress in layers—perhaps a light sweater beneath your favorite coat—and don a comfortable pair of shoes for wandering the streets. While the fog may retreat for now, there remains an inherent charm to an early walk along the waterfront or a leisurely exploration of the city’s vibrant neighborhoods. Enjoy the understated beauty of a San Francisco day; perhaps stroll through quieter alleys, relish a visit to an art gallery, or sip coffee while observing the world go by.
